name: Bordeaux
fun_fact: Fun fact: Bordeaux has the world's largest reflecting pool - the Miroir d'Eau is 3,450 square meters but only 2 centimeters deep. It creates a mesmerizing mirror effect of Place de la Bourse and cycles through three sequences: mirror reflection, mist, and 'swimming pool' mode every 20 minutes. The city produces 960 million bottles of wine per year from 287,000 acres of vineyards

hero_dishes.name: Arcachon Oysters
hero_dishes.description: Briny, plump oysters from the Arcachon Bay (40 miles west of Bordeaux) - served raw on ice with lemon, shallot vinegar, or eaten straight up. Sweet and iodine-fresh
hero_dishes.origin_story: Arcachon Bay has been France's oyster capital since the 1860s. The oyster beds benefit from a unique microclimate where ocean meets pine forests. Bordeaux wine merchants paired them with white Bordeaux wine centuries ago. Locals eat them by the dozen at outdoor caf√©s along the quays

hero_dishes.name: Lamproie √† la Bordelaise
hero_dishes.description: Lamprey eel cooked in Bordeaux red wine with leeks and ham. The eel's blood thickens the sauce into a dark, rich gravy. Looks medieval, tastes incredible
hero_dishes.origin_story: An ancient dish dating to medieval times when lampreys migrated up the Garonne River. English King Henry I supposedly died from eating too many lampreys in 1135. Bordeaux nobles considered it a delicacy. The blood-thickened sauce shocks modern diners but it's been Bordeaux tradition for 800+ years. Seasonal availability (winter/spring)
hero_dishes.where_to_find: La Tupina (Bordeaux institution for traditional cuisine), high-end traditional restaurants during lamprey season

signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Bordeaux produces 960 million bottles annually from 10,000 estates. Locals drink daily without pretension - order 'un verre de rouge' at lunch. Pair reds with entrec√¥te, whites with oysters, Sauternes with canel√©s. Visit Cit√© du Vin museum for tastings. Never add ice or mixers, that's sacrilege

signature_drinks.name: Entre-deux-Mers White Wine
signature_drinks.description: Crisp, affordable white wine from the region between Dordogne and Garonne rivers. Light, citrusy, perfect for everyday drinking
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: This is what Bordelais drink when not showing off fancy labels. Served chilled with seafood and summer salads. The name means 'between two seas' (actually two rivers). Best value in Bordeaux wine region
